intro: Cacalia alliariae var. kerneri, commonly known as Kern's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lanceolate in shape. This variety is relatively rare and is often found in specific regions of California.
